verses.text: Hezekiah began to reign \add when he was\add* five and twenty years old , and he reigned nine and twenty years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Abijah , the daughter of Zechariah.
And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that David his father had done. \p
¶ He in the first year of his reign , in the first month , opened the doors of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and repaired them.
And he brought in the priests and the Levites , and gathered them together into the east street ,

And said unto them, Hear me, ye Levites , sanctify now yourselves, and sanctify the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of your fathers , and carry forth the filthiness out of the holy \add place\add*.

For our fathers have trespassed , and done \add that which was\add* evil in the eyes of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* our God , and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and turned \add their\add* backs.  +  r 29.6  t turned their…: Heb. given the neck *
Also they have shut up the doors of the porch , and put out the lamps , and have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy \add place\add* unto the God of Israel.

Wherefore the wrath of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was upon Judah and Jerusalem , and he hath delivered them to trouble , to astonishment , and to hissing , as ye see with your eyes.\f + \fr 29.8 \ft trouble: Heb. commotion\f*
For, lo, our fathers have fallen by the sword , and our sons and our daughters and our wives \add are\add* in captivity for this.
Now \add it is\add* in mine heart to make a covenant with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , that his fierce wrath may turn away from us.

My sons , be not now negligent : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath chosen you to stand before him, to serve him, and that ye should minister unto him, and burn incense.\f + \fr 29.11 \ft be not…: or, be not now deceived\f*\f + \fr 29.11 \ft burn…: or, offer sacrifice\f* \p

¶ Then the Levites arose , Mahath the son of Amasai , and Joel the son of Azariah , of the sons of the Kohathites : and of the sons of Merari , Kish the son of Abdi , and Azariah the son of Jehalelel : and of the Gershonites ; Joah the son of Zimmah , and Eden the son of Joah :
And of the sons of Elizaphan ; Shimri , and Jeiel : and of the sons of Asaph ; Zechariah , and Mattaniah :
And of the sons of Heman ; Jehiel , and Shimei : and of the sons of Jeduthun ; Shemaiah , and Uzziel.

And they gathered their brethren , and sanctified themselves, and came , according to the commandment of the king , by the words of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to cleanse the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 29.15  t by the words…: or, in the business of the \+nd LORD\+nd* *

And the priests went into the inner part of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to cleanse \add it\add*, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* into the court of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And the Levites took \add it\add*, to carry \add it\add* out abroad into the brook Kidron.

Now they began on the first \add day\add* of the first month to sanctify , and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: so they sanctified the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* in eight days ; and in the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.

Then they went in to Hezekiah the king , and said , We have cleansed all the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the altar of burnt offering , with all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread table , with all the vessels thereof.

Moreover all the vessels , which king Ahaz in his reign did cast away in his transgression , have we prepared and sanctified , and, behold, they \add are\add* before the altar of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Then Hezekiah the king rose early , and gathered the rulers of the city , and went up to the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And they brought seven bullocks , and seven rams , and seven lambs , and seven he goats , for a sin offering for the kingdom , and for the sanctuary , and for Judah. And he commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer \add them\add* on the altar of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

So they killed the bullocks , and the priests received the blood , and sprinkled \add it\add* on the altar : likewise, when they had killed the rams , they sprinkled the blood upon the altar : they killed also the lambs , and they sprinkled the blood upon the altar.
And they brought forth the he goats \add for\add* the sin offering before the king and the congregation ; and they laid their hands upon them:\f + \fr 29.23 \ft forth: Heb. near\f*

And the priests killed them, and they made reconciliation with their blood upon the altar , to make an atonement for all Israel : for the king commanded \add that\add* the burnt offering and the sin offering \add should be made\add* for all Israel.

And he set the Levites in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* with cymbals , with psalteries , and with harps , according to the commandment of David , and of Gad the king’s seer , and Nathan the prophet : for \add so was\add* the commandment of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* by his prophets.  +  r 29.25  t commandment of the \+nd LORD\+nd*: Heb. commandment by the hand of the \+nd LORD\+nd* *  +  r 29.25  t by: Heb. by the hand of *
And the Levites stood with the instruments of David , and the priests with the trumpets.

And Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt offering upon the altar. And when the burnt offering began , the song of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* began \add also\add* with the trumpets , and with the instruments \add ordained\add* by David king of Israel.\f + \fr 29.27 \ft when: Heb. in the time\f*\f + \fr 29.27 \ft the instruments: Heb. hands of instruments\f*

And all the congregation worshipped , and the singers sang , and the trumpeters sounded : \add and\add* all \add this continued\add* until the burnt offering was finished.\f + \fr 29.28 \ft singers: Heb. song\f*
And when they had made an end of offering , the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves, and worshipped.\f + \fr 29.29 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praise unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with the words of David , and of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness , and they bowed their heads and worshipped.

Then Hezekiah answered and said , Now ye have consecrated yourselves unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And the congregation brought in sacrifices and thank offerings ; and as many as were of a free heart burnt offerings.  +  r 29.31  t consecrated…: or, filled your hand *

And the number of the burnt offerings , which the congregation brought , was threescore and ten bullocks , an hundred rams , \add and\add* two hundred lambs : all these \add were\add* for a burnt offering to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the consecrated things \add were\add* six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.

But the priests were too few , so that they could not flay all the burnt offerings : wherefore their brethren the Levites did help them, till the work was ended , and until the \add other\add* priests had sanctified themselves: for the Levites \add were\add* more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.\f + \fr 29.34 \ft did help…: Heb. strengthened them\f*

And also the burnt offerings \add were\add* in abundance , with the fat of the peace offerings , and the drink offerings for \add every\add* burnt offering. So the service of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was set in order.
And Hezekiah rejoiced , and all the people , that God had prepared the people : for the thing was \add done\add* suddenly.
